intro: Feuilleea schomburgkii, commonly known as the Schomburgk's featherplant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, velvety flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a feathery appearance, giving it its common name. Feuilleea schomburgkii thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
